abstracts.cdata!:
The outcome for the Fourth Poverty
            Reduction Support Credit for Burkina Faso was satisfactory,
            the institutional development impact was modest, the Bank
            performance was satisfactory, and the borrower performance
            was moderately satisfactory. Lessons learned from the
            project: In assessing overall progress in the implementation
            of reforms sought under Poverty Reduction Support Credits
            (PRSCs), one should take into account the track-record
            established by a country. One continuous lesson from
            PRSCs' implementation in Burkina is the need for
            strengthening the PRSC-related sectoral dialogue by
            involving more actively line ministries as well as Bank
            sector teams. An important issue is how Bank's teams
            could get better involved in budget preparation whether
            formally or informally. An emerging lesson is the need to
            pay more attention to the effectiveness of parallel support projects.
